criterion: Provides a clear and concise definition of panic attacks.
Mentions that panic attacks can be triggered by a specific event or situation.
Fails to acknowledge the emotional distress and fear associated with panic attacks.
Suggests seeking medical help immediately for panic attacks without considering individual circumstances.
Does not provide any information on the physical symptoms of panic attacks.
Uses technical jargon or complex medical terms without explaining them.
Mentions that panic attacks are not a serious condition and can be easily managed.
